page.title: 04 The Church
page.content: The village church was founded in 516 A.D and is{Church of ENGLAND,}built on a Celtic site having links with the abbey at Tavistock. Enlarged by the { {NORMANS}the tower is 75ft.high,has wood carved arches and a 500 year old font. Two {CLERESTORY WINDOWS}exist which are rare in Cornwall and Devon. There are 6 bells and part of a{ROOD {SCREEN.}A polished limestone alter with 5 consecrated carved crosses remain but were removed from the main church by order of{EDWARD V1.}Cromwell decreed a register be kept and records go back to 1649. South porch boasts it's original cradle roof and 15th. century wrought iron hinges. The organ was installed in 1880.The stained glass windows are a beautiful setting for christenings, weddings and funerals.
